alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Yakutat (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 15 at 3:15PM AKDT until March 17 at 10:00AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...Snow Followed by Heavy Rain for Southeast Alaska... .Snow continues to fall over the central and northern Panhandle through late Thursday. Heavy snow over the far northern Panhandle will last thought Thursday night, especially at higher elevations and locations along the border. Timing of the warming temperatures and the switch from snow over to rain for the Icy Strait Corridor is less certain and has been delayed. 2 to 5 inches of snow is still expected over the Icy Strait Corridor but possibly more with the delayed change to rain. For Yakutat moderate snow accumulations through Thursday evening before the main plume of moisture is expected to shift to west with significant snow accumulations expected through Friday morning. Still some uncertainty on where the plume of moisture tracks so this event will be monitored closely. ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THURSDAY TO 10 AM AKDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...City and Borough of Yakutat. * WHEN...From 6 PM Thursday to 10 AM AKDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact vehicular travel and aviation operations. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Moderate snow will fall through Thursday afternoon with heavy snow starting Thursday evening into Friday morning.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
